title: Am I the only one that thought the "mage update" was meant to.. increase the power of mages..?
body: the item changes have showed me that it's actually a global nerf to them.

replies.body:
Yes. Riot said repeatedly that the update was about distinguishing mages and making them healthier.

Just like every class update, it has nothing to do with power, they are trying to fix fundamental game health problems with the class.

Although I don't see how giving Annie a dash makes her weaker.
marksman update...?

https://media.giphy.com/media/1Z02vuppxP1Pa/giphy.gif

And for that matter, these changes seem like they are fundamentally beneficial for mages as a class. Giving increased access to CDR and mana means as a stat affinity is really beneficial for most mages.

It's not meant to just increase the power of mages. It's meant to help distinguish them from other mages both strategically and in gameplay, while also attempting to address some game health issues at the same time.

I'm really only speaking as to my perspective on the mages I'm currently working on (Cassiopeia and Malzahar), but if they release substantially stronger than they are currently, I'll be somewhat disappointed in their release state. The champions, and the items they use, are undergoing enough change that they should be a bit harder or a bit less familiar to play in the short term, with the gain of longer term differentiation and mastery. That's not to say I want any of them to release weak, but if Malzahar drops from his current high winrate into something lower than his historical average (at least for the short term while learning curve kicks in), I'd consider that a good sign more than an indication of him being too weak.

I couldn't understand why there aren't more AP-Armor options for the mages.  Apparently, they need these the most after Marksmen update.  To see Zhonya's being nerfed in damage and active cooldown, it's even more depressing.  Mages don't necessarily need cheaper items.  They actually need better slot-efficient items.

Zhonya's feels like a pretty solid buy from my experiences testing the item. Sure, it's less AP and the cooldown may be changed, but the addition of CDR and earlier access to the active due to lower cost has its upsides as well. I feel like the fact that there are so many mage items with Health on them makes Zhonya's have really strong synergy with those items now. Your effective Health against physical attackers is pretty decent with a good-size Health pool and the Armor from Zhonya's, and that's even before the active comes into play.

Please do elaborate. These are some of the kinds of things I'm pretty interested in making sure we've thought out.

The biggest issue I see is that a lot of the new items are trading off raw AP for CDR. I don't deny that having more accessible CDR will increase the overall reliability of a lot of AP champions and solve some of the awkward itemization choices they're forced to take right now. But, the problem I foresee is how it will affect champs that rely on raw burst (of which there are many)--items like Maw, Sterak's, and to a lesser extent Mercurial already put a big dent in their ability to actually burst effectively, and lowering raw AP across the board while drastically decreasing the cost of Banshee's Veil makes me apprehensive, especially when none of these new items seem particularly geared towards that class of champions.

I realize though that the changes shown so far might only be a subset of the total changes, but I would love to see some items like Luden's or Deathcap be a little more powerful/accessible to trade off for not having CDR/Mana (and for their ridiculous cost). Overall, though, I'm worried that the changes are going to be skewed in favor of sustained damage mages at the detriment of burst damage. I can't help but notice that all of the mages being reworked are all poke/sustained damage, too.
Perhaps he is referring to the fact that these proposed changes all reduce AP. Though i see quite a lot more health stats, i feel that this AP reduction will strike a large blow to most AP casters.

The games make it to about 25 min on average I've reached full build 3 times this season. Discounting the games where I have more gold than the rest of my team combined. 

Please explain to me how late game power will help mages, who almost universally have a weak late game to anything with cc/dive/poke/anykindofdamage, be better.

Mages still want max CDR eventually and enough mana and/or mana regen to be able to seige for awhile without needing to back frequently. 

These things are vital but might be taken for granted as itemization is now because mana regen is so prevalent. But now that they are making such heavy changes to the mana/mana regen systems, these new considerations will need to be taken into account. 

I mean, look at the Chalice and Athene's changes. They're completely different items now! And it's easy to look at the new Morellonomicon now and say that "Oh yeah okay they replaced the +100% mana regen with 400 mana, no big deal." But for

[a lot of champions](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/List_of_champion%27s_mana_regeneration) at level 18 that means you're trading 240* mana regen per minute for a flat 400!

For the current Morello to regen 400 mana right now (assuming you're level 18 with ~20 mana per 5) takes 1.667 minutes, so mathematically, coming off of a back, the new Morello will lose mana efficiency compared to the current one just after three minion waves. After that point we're in the red, mana-wise. Looks like seige-oriented mid laners are a bit fucked late game, doesn't it? Maybe this will be where the 1000g will go, idk.

Point is, maybe it'd need to go to AP/MPen, maybe not. These changes are system-wide so it's hard to predict how things will turn out in a vacuum.

 *For everyone after Ziggs, even more than 240 is lost.

The major problem is this new calculation of what you guys deem right for mage efficiency is a fallacy. Efficiency values of AD items are inherently more valuable for obvious reasons such as the fact that THEY APPLY TO AUTO ATTACKS and AD champs have higher ratios, sustain, etc. ADC items are more along the lines of the same efficiency values, BUT THEY MULTIPLY rapidly increasing their values when they go from 1 to 2 to 3 items. Mage items don't. Non ADC AD items are straight up more efficient than AP items.

It's incredibly disturbing that Xypherous is so completely dead set on using this new idea for what efficiency is right despite all the the data showing the contrary. Mages can NOT touch any tank, are outclassed early and mid game by AD counterparts, and fall off like a rock late game if it ever reaches that.

I'd honestly pay to see you guys spend 100 games in ranked playing mages, you would give up all hope on the class.

1000G doesn't come near enough to make them competitive vs any class late game, and doesn't address the fact of how weak they are relatively in both the mid and early game. If they're not comparable to other classes, early, mid or late game anymore, what's the reasoning behind that? The only reason they're even picked anymore is for mixed damage, which is why Corki/Ezreal are so popular mid in pro games.

Tanks? 1000G worth of stats more will still mean with a single Banshee's the tank can ignore mages and go for whatever target.

ADCs? They'll still kill mages late game with 3 near guaranteed crits and the state of the game now, especially with the upcoming mage nerfs, makes it incredibly difficult to ever 100-0 one. Maw makes it actually impossible even after that "nerf" it got last patch, and if the mage is not ahead even if they don't have Maw it's not possible to 100-0 one.

Why am I writing everything over and over again. Can you honestly read what I wrote here and tell me if I'm wrong, tell me if you actually disagree with the main points - http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/uK1XQykM-state-of-the-game-with-meddler-zirene-and-more?comment=0024

**Tl;dr - Everyone, including the pros, felt that the preaseason 6 nerfs to mages were not only too extreme, but uncalled for to begin with. Now you're doubling down on them, a lot of us are quitting the game including myself after 5 years.**

Mages are supposed to be able to out burst ADCs and as a Mage player it really feels like they are struggling in that right now. ADCs get itemization that allowed to them to survive burst and do more damage - Maw, Sterak's, Scimitar - which are barely being touched at all. There is more accessible MR for Mage targets than ever yet there isn't much in the way of MR Pen. 

Sterak's shield should scale heavily with EDIT: bonus health. Maw shouldn't be a massive anti-mage stat-stick that gives AD, Armor Pen, Magic Resist, a incredibly powerful shield, and the mini-stat-stick of the secondary passive. There is literally no drawback to rushing Maw for AD - it fits perfectly as a first item - but Zhonyas is a crap rush for mages since even with these changes seekers/Zhonyas as an early item will remain crappy to rush since it provides nothing in terms of mana sustaining power.

That's all ignoring the sheer amount of burst that ADCs are doing right now *which they shouldn't be able to*. Burst is not supposed to be ADC territory by Riot's own definitions. ADCs are supposed to be sustained damage dealers.

> Burst is not supposed to be ADC territory by Riot's own definitions. ADCs are supposed to be sustained damage dealers. 

Totally agree with this sentiment, and I do think recent item adjustments have shown the balance team does as well. I will say that I don't think mages should unanimously be burst champions though. Absolutely some should be, but others do operate as more sustained damage threats.

You are correct. People seem to think Mages all fall into one universal class when in reality it's more like 7 or 8. I just wish we got more items than you guys have made at the moment simply because Mages are the most diverse class in the game, and even with the new items added some of the classes (zone and poke mages being the large ones) feel like they're getting left behind.
Jhin has more burst damage than 95% of the mages...

The current itemization doesn't really help them all that much, unless you're Ryze and barely build any actual mage items anyway. Like, Seraph's is okay, but that melts quickly, and Zhonya's, while still useful, is of significantly less benefit to a Cass than it would be to a burst mage. This leaves Rylai's and Abyssal; Rylai's is nice, but it doesn't really help you when someone is already jumping on you; it's more offensive, apart from the health. And Abyssal is just flat out overtuned anyway.

Is there a reason why AD champions have such a wide, variety of access to armor pen this season, while mages are simply stuck with Haunting Guise/Liandry, which isn't even that great of a buy on most mages other than Malzahar and ocassionally, Zyra and Cassiopeia?

ADC itemisation is superior to mage itemisation. You can think about ADC items: do I want to be an AD caster? Essence Reaver. Do I want poke? Rapidfire. Do I want AoE? Shiv. Do I need to duel? Phantom Dancer. Am I dying quickly? Guardian's Angel or Bloodthirster. Do I need MORE AoE? Runaan's. Just more damage? Infinity Edge. Are they stacking armour and HP? Lord Dominik. Armour, but a lot of sustain? Mortal Reminder.

What do AP mages have to think about? We must get Zhonya, because it's the only AP item that gives us some defence against being bursted down, both by its Active and due to having Armour. We have to buy Rabadon's Deathcap, because there's no other strong multiplier for AP. We need either Morellonomicon, Rod of Ages or Athene's Unholy Grail to provide us with enough Mana (Regen) to get around our greatest weakness:

*Every AP Mana champion's weakness is their total and utter reliance on casting spells, while being limited by a resource they can't easily recover.*

An ADC like Varus can opt into Essence Reaver to solve Mana issues, because some AAs will definitely get him back the Mana he needs to sustain his spellcasting pattern.

An AP champion like Syndra has no such options, besides increasing her passive mana regen.

The current proposed changes to mage itemisation suggests that AP champions aren't hampered by resources enough and *emphasises a weakness*, namely the complete and utter reliance mages have on Mana. As if that isn't bad enough, we also get a slap to the face and insult to injury by lowering AP values for some of these items, meaning **new itemisation looks to emphasise a weakness without adding strength**, and it implies mages as a whole are currently considered unhealthy. In a game where you can be deleted for 60 seconds within 1 second.

Where before, Syndra and Veigar could decide between Morellonomicon and Athene's Unholy Grail depending on whether they wanted to fight long fights or burst someone down, the new itemisation changes are telling us we don't need to think about what items to buy; we buy Morellonomicon, because we don't deserve to have another option in that slot.

These changes hurt Mages, because our agency of selecting an item build is being shoehorned into a specific direction by removing options and worsening items that were used for specific cases. Zhonya's is made worse so that we can be allowed to buy it sooner, but it means we'll be giving up our lategame power... again. Someone like Zed has the fullest agency to build damage with every item he buys, but we're getting nerfed on the AP for defensive items we buy, resulting in a loss of damaging ability *without a gain in defensive strength*. 

I truly, truly want to like the changes, but in the thread there is talk about unhealthy gameplay and how "infinite poke" isn't healthy... but meanwhile, things like Zed *do* get infinite poke.
